node.title: Unemployment drops as lockdowns end, employers snap up 366,000 staff
node.alt: a blackboard outside a cafe advertising for staff
node.description: Australia's unemployment rate dropsÂ sharply after lockdowns, with employers scrambling to hire hundreds of thousands of extra staff as many businesses reopened.
node.content: ["Australia's unemployment rate has dropped sharply after lockdowns, with employers scrambling to hire staff.", "Official ABS data\u00a0shows the unemployment rate dived from 5.2 in October to 4.6 per cent in November, after lockdowns had ended in New South Wales, Victoria and the ACT.", "The drop came despite a massive increase in the percentage of people in work or looking for it, with a whopping 366,100 extra people estimated to have been in work last month.", "Other labour market indicators were also positive, with underemployment dropping from 9.5 to 7.5 per cent and hours worked up 4.5 per cent.", "The numbers were almost totally driven by the rapid rebound in employment in New South Wales and Victoria as key sectors such as hospitality, tourism, recreation and personal services were allowed to trade again with minimal restrictions.", "\"The easing of restrictions in both New South Wales and Victoria had a large influence on the national figures, with employment in the two states increasing by 180,000 people and 141,000 people between October and November,\" said the bureau's head of labour statistics, Bjorn Jarvis.", "More to come."]
